intro: Stigmaphyllon hypargyreum, commonly known as the golden stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with lobed margins, and its stems are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or limestone soils.
